oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Comprehensive design of a sensor network for chemical plants based on various diagnosability and reliability criteria. 2. Applications
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: BHUSHAN, M
RENGASWAMY, R
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: eastman challenge process
signed directed graph
steady-state analysis
fault-diagnosis
wide control
pceg model
digraph
systems
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In part I of this series of papers, a framework for finding a reliable sensor network from a fault diagnosis perspective was presented. To illustrate the issues involved and underscore the utility of the discussed approach, a case study is presented in this part. A large flowsheet, the Tennessee-Eastman flowsheet, is considered for the case study. For various cases, sensor location is performed, and the results are compared.
